refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect2.title: enum SchroEncoderFrameStateEnum
refsect2.programlisting: typedef enum { SCHRO_ENCODER_FRAME_STAGE_NEW = 0, SCHRO_ENCODER_FRAME_STAGE_ANALYSE, SCHRO_ENCODER_FRAME_STAGE_HAVE_GOP, SCHRO_ENCODER_FRAME_STAGE_HAVE_PARAMS, SCHRO_ENCODER_FRAME_STAGE_PREDICT_ROUGH, SCHRO_ENCODER_FRAME_STAGE_PREDICT_PEL, SCHRO_ENCODER_FRAME_STAGE_PREDICT_SUBPEL, SCHRO_ENCODER_FRAME_STAGE_MODE_DECISION, SCHRO_ENCODER_FRAME_STAGE_HAVE_REFS, SCHRO_ENCODER_FRAME_STAGE_HAVE_QUANTS, SCHRO_ENCODER_FRAME_STAGE_ENCODING, SCHRO_ENCODER_FRAME_STAGE_RECONSTRUCT, SCHRO_ENCODER_FRAME_STAGE_POSTANALYSE, SCHRO_ENCODER_FRAME_STAGE_DONE, SCHRO_ENCODER_FRAME_STAGE_FREE, SCHRO_ENCODER_FRAME_STAGE_LAST /* this should be last */ } SchroEncoderFrameStateEnum;

refsect2.title: enum SchroEncoderPerceptualEnum
enum SchroQuantiserEngineEnum
enum SchroStateEnum
enum SchroEncoderGOPEnum
SchroEncoderSetting
schro_encoder_free ()
refsect2.para: Frees an encoder object and all its resources.

refsect2.title: schro_encoder_get_video_format ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new SchroVideoFormat structure and copies the video format information of decoder into it.
When no longer needed, the returned pointer should be freed using free().

listitem.simpara: a pointer to a SchroVideoFormat structure

refsect2.title: schro_encoder_set_video_format ()
refsect2.para: Sets the video format used by encoder to the values specified in format. This function may only be called before schro_encoder_start() is called on the encoder.

refsect2.title: schro_encoder_end_of_stream ()
refsect2.para: Tells the encoder that the end of the stream has been reached, and no more frames are available to encode. The encoder will then finish encoding.

refsect2.title: schro_encoder_push_frame ()
refsect2.para: Provides a frame to the encoder to encode.

refsect2.title: schro_encoder_pull ()
refsect2.para: Pulls a buffer of compressed video from the encoder. If presentation_frame is not NULL, the frame number of the latest decodable frame is returned.

refsect2.title: schro_encoder_encode_auxiliary_data ()
refsect2.programlisting: SchroBuffer* schro_encoder_encode_auxiliary_data (SchroEncoder *encoder, SchroAuxiliaryDataID id, void *data, int size);
refsect2.para: Packs data into a Dirac auxiliary data packet.

refsect2.title: schro_encoder_encode_subband ()
schro_encoder_encode_subband_noarith ()
refsect2.programlisting: void schro_encoder_encode_subband_noarith (SchroEncoderFrame *frame, int component, int index);

refsect2.title: schro_encoder_frame_insert_buffer ()
refsect2.para: Inserts a buffer into an encoder frame.

refsect2.title: schro_encoder_insert_buffer ()
refsect2.para: Inserts an application-provided buffer into the encoded video stream with the next frame that is pushed.

refsect2.title: schro_encoder_output_push ()
refsect2.programlisting: void schro_encoder_output_push (SchroEncoder *encoder, SchroBuffer *buffer, int slot, int presentation_frame);

refsect2.title: schro_encoder_push_ready ()
refsect2.para: Returns true if the encoder has available space for additional video frames.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the encoder is ready for another video frame to be pushed.

refsect2.title: schro_encoder_start ()
refsect2.para: Locks in encoder configuration and causes the encoder to start encoding pictures. At this point, the encoder will start worker threads to do the actual encoding.

refsect2.title: schro_encoder_wait ()
refsect2.para: Checks the state of the encoder. If the encoder requires the application to do something, an appropriate state code is returned. Otherwise, this function waits until the encoder requires the application to do something.

listitem.simpara: the current value of an encoder option given by name

refsect2.title: schro_encoder_setting_set_double ()
refsect2.para: set the encoder option given by name to value.
